00007 void
00008 bgp_ospf_init(bgp_state * bs, bgp_route * r, tw_lp * lp)
00009 {
00010         rn_lp_state     *rn_state;
00011         rn_stream       *s;
00012         rn_area         *ar;
00013 
00014         ospf_state      *state;
00015 
00016         ospf_db_entry   *dbe;
00017 
00018         int              entry;
00019 
00020         ar = rn_getarea(rn_getmachine(lp->id));
00021         entry = ar->nmachines + ar->as->nareas + r->dst;
00022 
00023         rn_state = lp->cur_state;
00024         s = rn_getstream_byport(rn_state, 23);
00025 
00026         if(!s || s->port != 23)
00027                 return;
00028 
00029         state = s->layers[0].lp.cur_state;
00030         dbe = &state->db[entry];
00031 
00032         /*** CANNOT RE-BUILD ROUTING TABLES !!! ***/
00033 
00034         if(NULL == r)
00035         {
00036                 // remove from database
00037                 ospf_db_remove(state, entry, lp);
00038         } else if(1 == dbe->b.free)
00039         {
00040                 // insert into DB
00041                 dbe->b.age = 0;
00042                 dbe->b.free = 0;
00043                 dbe->b.entry = entry;
00044                 dbe->seqnum = OSPF_MIN_LSA_SEQNUM;
00045                 dbe->lsa = bgp_lsa_find(bs, state, r, entry, lp);
00046 
00047                 ospf_db_route(state, dbe, lp);
00048         } else
00049         {
00050                 // update database
00051                 dbe = &state->db[entry];
00052 
00053                 dbe->b.age = 0;
00054                 dbe->b.free = 0;
00055                 dbe->b.entry = entry;
00056                 dbe->seqnum = OSPF_MIN_LSA_SEQNUM;
00057                 dbe->lsa = bgp_lsa_find(bs, state, r, entry, lp);
00058 
00059                 ospf_db_route(state, dbe, lp);
00060         }
00061 
00062 #if VERIFY_BGP
00063         fprintf(bs->log, "\tinitialized OSPF lsa: AS %d, LSA %d \n", 
00064                 r->dst, entry);
00065 #endif
00066 }
00067 
00068 // LSA for AS must have same number of links as FULL neighbors?
00069 void
00070 bgp_ospf_update(bgp_state * bs, rn_as * dest_as, bgp_route * r, int add, tw_lp * lp)
00071 {
00072 #ifdef HAVE_OSPF_H
00073         tw_lp           *cur_lp;
00074 
00075         rn_lp_state     *rn_state;
00076         rn_area         *ar;
00077         rn_stream       *s;
00078 
00079         ospf_state      *state;
00080 
00081         ospf_db_entry   *dbe;
00082         ospf_lsa        *old_lsa;
00083         ospf_nbr         nbr;
00084 
00085         int              entry;
00086         int              cur_stream;
00087 
00088         ar = rn_getarea(rn_getmachine(lp->id));
00089         entry = ar->nmachines + ar->as->nareas + dest_as->id;
00090 
00091         // Get the OSPF router state
00092         rn_state = lp->cur_state;
00093         cur_stream = rn_state->cur_stream;
00094         cur_lp = rn_state->cur_lp;
00095 
00096         s = rn_getstream_byport(rn_state, 23);
00097 
00098         if(!s || s->port != 23)
00099         {
00100                 printf("%ld: Did not send update (%d) to OSPF! \n", lp->id, add);
00101                 rn_state->cur_stream = cur_stream;
00102 
00103                 return;
00104         }
00105 
00106         state = s->layers[0].lp.cur_state;
00107         rn_state->cur_lp = &s->layers[0].lp;
00108 
00109         // Get and fill in the new LSA
00110         dbe = &state->db[entry];
00111 
00112 /*
00113         You *MUST* restore the cur_stream and cur_lp pointers
00114         BEFORE return-ing from this function!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
00115 
00116         If you don't, future BGP pkts will go to OSPF on the
00117         other side of the connection!
00118 */
00119 
00120         if(add && dbe->b.free == 0)
00121         {
00122                 // If multiple possible originators,
00123                 // rtr w/ > id is originator.  
00124                 // Eliminates oscillation / duplicate effort
00125                 old_lsa = getlsa(state->m, dbe->lsa, entry);
00126 
00127                 if(old_lsa && lp->id < old_lsa->adv_r)
00128                 {
00129                         rn_state->cur_lp = cur_lp;
00130                         rn_state->cur_stream = cur_stream;
00131 
00132                         return;
00133                 }
00134 
00135                 // No need to change LSA is route src has not changed!
00136                 if(old_lsa)
00137                 {
00138                         ospf_lsa_link *l = tw_memory_data(old_lsa->links.head);
00139 
00140                         if(l->dst == r->src && old_lsa->adv_r == lp->id)
00141                         {
00142                                 rn_state->cur_lp = cur_lp;
00143                                 rn_state->cur_stream = cur_stream;
00144 
00145                                 return;
00146                         }
00147                 }
00148         }
00149 
00150         /*
00151          * Construct the DB entry we need, and have OSPF process it.
00152          * If we wanted to connect BGP to OSPF on different routers,
00153          * we would simply need to send the OSPF node an UPDATE message
00154          */
00155         //dbe->b.entry = entry;
00156         dbe->cause_bgp = 1;
00157         dbe->lsa = bgp_lsa_find(bs, state, r, entry, lp);
00158 
00159         nbr.id = r->src;
00160         nbr.state = ospf_nbr_full_st;
00161 
00162         if(add)
00163         {
00164                 dbe->b.age = 0;
00165                 dbe->b.free = 0;
00166                 dbe->seqnum = state->lsa_seqnum;
00167                 ospf_lsa_create(state, &nbr, entry, lp);
00168         } else
00169         {
00170                 if(dbe->b.free)
00171                 {
00172                         rn_state->cur_stream = cur_stream;
00173                         rn_state->cur_lp = cur_lp;
00174                         return;
00175                 }
00176 
00177                 dbe->b.age = OSPF_LSA_MAX_AGE;
00178                 ospf_lsa_create(state, &nbr, entry, lp);
00179                 dbe->b.free = 1;
00180         }
00181 
00182         state->stats->s_cause_bgp++;
00183 
00184 #if VERIFY_BGP
00185         if(add)
00186                 fprintf(bs->log, "\tinstalled lsa into OSPF! AS %d, LSA %d \n", 
00187                         dest_as->id, entry);
00188         else
00189                 fprintf(bs->log, "removed lsa from OSPF! \n");
00190 #endif
00191 
00192         rn_state->cur_stream = cur_stream;
00193         rn_state->cur_lp = cur_lp;
00194 #endif
00195 }
00196 
00197 /*
00198  * The id determines which type of LSA we wish to find.
00199  *
00200  * If looking for AS ext lsa : compare g_ospf_lsa LSAs to current links to that AS
00201  */
00202 int
00203 bgp_lsa_find(bgp_state * bstate, ospf_state * state, bgp_route * r, int id, tw_lp * lp)
00204 {
00205         tw_memory       *b;
00206 
00207         ospf_lsa_link   *ll;
00208         ospf_lsa        *lsa;
00209 
00210         int              index;
00211         int              nlinks;
00212         int              x_id;
00213 
00214         nlinks = 0;
00215         x_id = id - state->ar->nmachines - state->ar->as->nareas;
00216 
00217         b = state->ar->g_ospf_lsa[id];
00218         lsa = tw_memory_data(b);
00219         for(index = 0; NULL != lsa; index++)
00220         {
00221                 if(lsa->links.size == 1 && lsa->adv_r == lp->id)
00222                 {
00223                         // foreach LSA link: if is up, good, otherwise, not the LSA!
00224                         b = lsa->links.head;
00225                         ll = tw_memory_data(b);
00226 
00227                         if(ll->dst == r->src)
00228                                 return index;
00229                 }
00230 
00231                 if(lsa->next == NULL)
00232                 {
00233                         index++;
00234                         break;
00235                 }
00236 
00237                 b = lsa->next;
00238                 lsa = tw_memory_data(b);
00239         }
00240 
00241         if(index > 1)
00242         {
00243         b = state->ar->g_ospf_lsa[id];
00244         lsa = tw_memory_data(b);
00245         for(index = 0; NULL != lsa; index++)
00246         {
00247                 if(lsa->links.size == 1 && lsa->adv_r == lp->id)
00248                 {
00249                         // foreach LSA link: if is up, good, otherwise, not the LSA!
00250                         b = lsa->links.head;
00251                         ll = tw_memory_data(b);
00252 
00253                         if(ll->dst == r->src)
00254                                 return index;
00255                 }
00256 
00257                 if(lsa->next == NULL)
00258                 {
00259                         index++;
00260                         break;
00261                 }
00262 
00263                 b = lsa->next;
00264                 lsa = tw_memory_data(b);
00265         }
00266         }
00267 
00268         if(lsa->next != NULL)
00269                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Not at end of list!");
00270 
00271         lsa->next = ospf_lsa_allocate(lp);
00272         lsa = tw_memory_data(lsa->next);
00273 
00274         lsa->id = id;
00275         lsa->adv_r = lp->id;
00276         lsa->type = ospf_lsa_as_ext;
00277 
00278         b = tw_memory_alloc(lp, g_ospf_ll_fd);
00279         tw_memoryq_push(&lsa->links, b);
00280 
00281         ll = tw_memory_data(b);
00282         ll->dst = r->src;
00283 
00284         if(rn_getas(rn_getmachine(r->src)) == bstate->as)
00285                 ll->metric = state->m->link[rn_route(state->m, r->src)].cost;
00286         else
00287                 ll->metric = rn_getlink(state->m, r->src)->cost;
00288 
00289         //printf("%ld: created new LSA: %d, ll->dst %d \n", lp->id, lsa->id, ll->dst);
00290         //bgp_lsa_link_allocate(bstate, state, r, lsa, x_id, lp);
00291 
00292         return index;
00293 }
00294 
00295 void
00296 bgp_lsa_link_allocate(bgp_state * bstate, ospf_state * state, 
00297                         ospf_lsa * lsa, int x_id, tw_lp * lp)
00298 {
00299         tw_memory       *b;
00300 
00301         rn_as           *d_as;
00302 
00303         ospf_lsa_link   *l;
00304         bgp_nbr         *nbr;
00305 
00306         int              i;
00307 
00308         // go by neighbor states, not topology, unless AS external LSA
00309         for(i = 0; i < bstate->n_interfaces; i++)
00310         {
00311                 nbr = &bstate->nbr[i];
00312                 d_as = rn_getas(rn_getmachine(nbr->id));
00313 
00314                 if(d_as->id == x_id)
00315                 {
00316                         b = tw_memory_alloc(lp, g_ospf_ll_fd);
00317                         tw_memoryq_push(&lsa->links, b);
00318 
00319                         l = tw_memory_data(b);
00320                         l->dst = nbr->id;
00321                         l->metric = state->m->link[i].cost;
00322                 }
00323         }
00324 
00325         lsa->length = OSPF_LSA_UPDATE_HEADER + 
00326                         (lsa->links.size * OSPF_LSA_LINK_LENGTH);
00327 }

00329 void
00330 bgp_ospf_flush(bgp_state * bs, rn_as * dest_as, bgp_route * r, int add, tw_lp * lp)
00331 {
00332         tw_error(TW_LOC, "argh");
00333 }
